title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Senior Software Engineer


**Date:** Aug 6, 2025
**Location:**Stockholm, SE
**Company:** Maquet Critical Care AB
**Remote Work:****With a passion for life**  

Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.  



**Om denna möjlighet**

Vi söker nu en Software Embedded C++ Engineer som vill vara med och utveckla innovativ medicinteknik tillsammans med kompetenta och engagerade kollegor. I Solna utvecklar och tillverkar Getinge ventilatorer och anestesisystem som används i intensivvård och operationssalar världen över.

I denna roll kommer du att arbeta med en av de mest centrala delarna i våra produkter – systemet som levererar terapi – vilket gör en verklig skillnad i människors liv. Vi söker dig som kan starta omgående till vår R&D-avdelning i Solna. Du kommer att ingå i ett agilt team som ansvarar för terapileverans i våra ventilatorer – produkter som spelat en avgörande roll under pandemin. Teamet ansvarar för hela värdekedjan, från koncept till färdig release.  

**Vad du kommer göra**

I rollen som Embedded C++ Engineer arbetar du i ett tvärfunktionellt team med både nyutveckling och underhåll av våra produkter. Fokus ligger på utveckling av mjukvaran som styr terapileveransen – det vill säga den som reglerar patientens andetag – i flera av våra produkter.  


Utvecklingen sker främst i C++, och vi följer en strukturerad utvecklingsprocess enligt standarden IEC 62304 samt både FDA:s och EU:s regelverk. Vi använder GitLab för versionshantering, integration och automatisering.  


Du och dina kollegor arbetar nära varandra, delar kunskap och bidrar till varandras utveckling. Tillsammans säkerställer ni att patienter får tillgång till högkvalitativ och säker mjukvara – i rätt tid.

Tjänsten utgår från vårt kontor i Solna, men vi tillämpar ett hybridupplägg där distansarbete kombineras med kontorsdagar.  


**Vad du har med dig**

För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:

* Civil- eller högskoleingenjörsexamen inom Elektronik, Datavetenskap, Teknisk fysik, Mekatronik eller liknande
* 3–5 års erfarenhet av arbete inom R&D
* Ett brinnande intresse för C++ och en vilja att arbeta med modern C++
* Erfarenhet av Git, GitLab och Linux som utvecklingsmiljö
* Goda kunskaper i engelska i tal och skrift (svenska är meriterande)
**Meriterande erfarenheter:**

* Ramverk för grafiska gränssnitt, gärna QT/QML
* Automatiserade testverktyg och Python
* Realtidssystem för inbyggda system, styr och reglerteknik
* Förståelse för regelverk inom medicinteknik
* Intresse för CI/CD
  


  

Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som är lösningsorienterad och tar egna initiativ. Du trivs med att arbeta i team och har en god samarbetsförmåga. Att lösa komplexa problem tillsammans med andra ser du som en stimulerande utmaning. Du är nyfiken, prestigelös och öppen för att lära dig nya saker – och samtidigt kvalitetsmedveten och noggrann i ditt arbete.  


På Getinge omfamnar vi en lärandekultur där vi tar ansvar för vår utveckling och värdesätter kvalitet och samarbete högt. Framför allt bryr vi oss om varandra – det är så vi fortsätter utveckla världsledande produkter. Vi är Team Players, Forward Thinkers och Game Changers!  


**Vi erbjuder**

Vi erbjuder ett konkurrenskraftigt kompensations- och förmånspaket, inklusive friskvårdsbidrag, familjeförmåner samt gemensamma aktiviteter och föreningsliv. Allt för att stödja ditt välbefinnande och dina mål. Hos oss råder en öppen dialog mellan ledare och medarbetare samt mellan teamen. Vi har fokus på utveckling, och tillsammans lägger vi upp en plan för lärande och kompetensutveckling från dag ett i din karriär hos oss.  

  

**Hos oss får du:**

* Arbeta på ett medtech-bolag som räddar liv och har engagerade medarbetare
* En modern och flexibel arbetsmiljö med möjlighet till distansarbete
* Långsiktig satsning på din personliga utveckling
**Ansökan**

Urval sker löpande och vi rekommenderar därför att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast 2025-09-01. Observera att tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Skicka din ansökan via vårt rekryteringssystem genom att klicka på knappen "ansök nu". På grund av GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar via e-post.  


Har du frågor om rollen? Vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Richard Af Klint på richard.afklint@getinge.com / 070-782 78 35 eller rekryterare Frida Svensson på frida.svensson@getinge.com.  


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan och hoppas att du vill följa med oss på vår resa mot att bli världens mest eftertraktade medicintekniska företag.  


**About us**With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.  


Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
company_description: Getinge is a global leading supplier of innovative medtech products and solutions within healthcare and life science.

title: Systemadministratör till familjärt företag
description:
I rollen som konsult på SysPartner erbjuds du konsultuppdrag där du ges du möjlighet till snabb utveckling och chans att höja din kompetens inom relevanta områden. Vi jobbar framförallt med längre uppdrag och våra kunder är oftast medelstora och stora bolag med spännande miljöer i teknisk framkant.


Som systemadministratör möts du bland annat av dessa uppgifter:

* Deployment och administration av servrar
* Planering och produktionssättningar av nya system
* Avancerad felsökning av klient, server och nätverk
* Automation och scriptning
* Migreringar

### **Vem är du?**


Vi söker dig som, precis som vi, har ett stort tekniskt intresse och gillar att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och hänga med i branschens utveckling. I rollen som konsult är du vårt ansikte utåt vilket kräver ett gott kundbemötande och en professionell attityd. Vi söker en ödmjuk och ärlig person som visar intresse och nyfikenhet för uppgiften.


För att passa i rollen som systemadministratör tror vi att du har arbetat minst två år inom området. Om du har specialistkompetens inom något eller några av följande områden är det meriterande:

* PowerShell
* Migreringar och plattformsuppgraderingar
* Virtualiseringsplattformar på OS och applikationsnivå
* Sql och Exchange
* Azure, Office365 och andra molnplattformar


Du behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift. Befattningen kan komma att kräva att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tids gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där krav finns på säkerhetsklassinplacering, kan i förekommande fall, medföras krav på visst medborgarskap.

### **Vilka är vi?**


SysPartner levererar tjänster inom infrastruktur (Linux och Windows) samt systemutveckling. Vårt fokus ligger på konsultverksamhet men vi har även hostinglösningar och helhetskoncept för IT-drift. SysPartner har funnits sedan 2005 och har kontor i Linköping, Västerås, Stockholm och Luleå.


Vi strävar efter att vara det lilla familjära företaget samtidigt som våra konsulter ofta får chansen att arbeta i en större organisation med spännande tekniska lösningar hos våra kunder. SysPartner erbjuder dig som anställd en rad personalförmåner som vi är väldigt stolta över. Vi är alltid på jakt efter nya kollegor som vill vara med på vår fortsatta utvecklingsresa framåt!

### **Låter det spännande?**


Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Let’s Build the Future of Recruitment Together**


At Teamtailor, we believe that building happy teams is the foundation of a thriving business. As a leading employer branding and recruitment platform, used by over **10,000 companies** and **200,000 users worldwide** we’re on a mission to shape the future of hiring. Now, we’re inviting you to be part of that journey.


Working with us means joining a young and fast-growing tech company with a truly international mindset and a strong sense of purpose. This is more than just a job. It is a chance to make a real impact, take on meaningful responsibilities, and play an active role in the growth of both our product and our company. You will also be part of a vibrant and diverse team where different backgrounds and perspectives are celebrated. We believe work should be both inspiring and fun.

**What We’re Looking For**


We’re expanding our **Data Team** and looking for a **skilled and experienced Data Engineer** to join us on our journey. If you enjoy building reliable data pipelines, cleaning messy datasets, and making data ready for analysis and action, you’ll feel right at home here.

**You Bring:**


* **3–5 years of experience** in Data Engineering or a similar role
* Strong knowledge of **dbt**, **SQL**, and **data modeling** best practices.
* Solid experience with **Python**, especially for building data workflows and working with APIs.
* A proactive mindset around **data cleanliness**, **automation**, and **system reliability**.
* A **positive attitude**. You see opportunities where others see obstacles.
* Ability to **work** **independently** and take ownership of tasks with minimal supervision.
* Comfortable collaborating across teams in a **fast-paced, product-driven** environment.
* Fluent **English** (written and spoken).

 **Bonus Points If You Have:**

* Experience working with **Google Cloud Platform (GCP)**

 **️ What You’ll Do**

* Design, build, and maintain **data pipelines** using **dbt** for transformation and modeling.
* Manage data flowing **in and out of** our platform.
* Set up and maintain **data quality checks** and **alerting systems**.
* Create and maintain **data warehouse tables**, ensuring data is clean, trusted, and accessible.

 **What Teamtailor Offers You**

* The chance to work at one of **Europe’s fastest-growing SaaS companies**
* A **fantastic team** that supports and lifts each other
* **Competitive salary** and **pension package**
* An **annual company trip abroad** and regular team events
* **Wellness allowance** to support your healthy lifestyle ️‍️

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Senior Software Engineer


**Date:** Aug 4, 2025
**Location:**Stockholm, SE
**Company:** Maquet Critical Care AB
**Remote Work:** 1-2 days at home (site based)  

**With a passion for life**  


Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.  



**About this opportunity**  


We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer with strong expertise in embedded systems for medical interoperability (SDPi/SDC), hands-on experience with Azure Cloud infrastructure, and a proven track record of leading engineering teams. In this hybrid role, you’ll be both a senior individual contributor and the technical lead, helping drive embedded–cloud integration, mentoring developers, and shaping our architecture and connectivity strategy.

You'll join a growing applications team building modern, scalable software for next-generation medical devices. Our work spans from embedded C++ applications and SDPi-compliant communication stacks to Go-based backend services and cloud-native infrastructure on Azure using Kubernetes.

If you're passionate about interoperability standards, building robust, secure, and regulatory-compliant systems from edge to cloud, and you're ready to take on technical leadership responsibilities—we’d love to hear from you.  


**Our Tech Stack**  


Here’s a look at the tools and technologies you’ll be working with:  


* Languages & Frameworks: C++, Rust, Go (Golang), TypeScript, React, Java



* Interoperability & Standards: SDPi, SDC (IEEE 11073), HL7-FHIR, MQTT



* Cloud Platform: Microsoft Azure (AKS, Event Grid)



* Containers & Orchestration: Docker, Kubernetes



* Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, Helm, Ansible



* CI/CD: GitLab CI



* Monitoring & Logging: Prometheus, Grafana



* Version Control: GitLab

  


We’re constantly evolving our stack to meet new challenges—your input will directly shape our future architecture.  


**What you will do**  


  

As a technical leader, you will guide a cross-functional development team, driving architectural decisions around embedded systems, SDPi/SDC interoperability, and cloud integration. You’ll contribute hands-on across the stack, ensuring performance, security, and regulatory compliance in a medical context.  


**Key responsibilities include:**

* Embedded & Interoperability Development: Build C++ applications for secure, SDPi/SDC-based device and gateway communication.
* Cloud & Backend Systems: Lead the evolution of our Azure infrastructure (AKS, messaging, telemetry) and develop performant backend services in Go.
* DevOps & Security: Champion CI/CD, infrastructure as code, and compliance (e.g., IEC 62304), while ensuring secure, traceable, and maintainable code.
* Cross-Team Collaboration: Align closely with frontend (React/TypeScript), QA, clinical experts, and product teams to deliver integrated, high-quality solutions.
  


**You will bring**  


To be successful in this position, we believe you should have the following qualifications:  


* Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s in Computer Science, Embedded Systems, or related field.



* Embedded/SDPi Expertise: Strong hands-on experience in C++ for embedded systems, and/or deep familiarity with SDPi/SDC stack (e.g., BICEPS, MDIB) for medical device communication.



* Leadership Experience: Prior role as tech lead, team lead, or principal engineer, ideally in cross-disciplinary environments.



* Azure & Cloud: Experience with Azure cloud services and device-to-cloud integration patterns.



* Go Expertise: Professional experience building backend applications in Go.



* DevOps Practices: CI/CD with GitLab, infrastructure automation with Terraform/Helm.



* Interdisciplinary Collaboration: Ability to navigate between device firmware, backend systems, and cloud infrastructure.
  


You should be comfortable working across disciplines, aligning backend, frontend, and infrastructure needs. A structured yet flexible approach to problem-solving—especially in debugging, system design, and performance—is important. Experience with React/TypeScript, MQTT, SDC (IEEE 11073-20701), SDPi, HL7 FHIR, and healthcare standards like IEC 62304 or ISO 13485 is a plus. Familiarity with GraphQL or REST APIs, Agile teams, and a passion for mentorship and engineering culture are also valuable.  


**Why join Getinge**  


You’ll work on cutting-edge medical software that spans embedded firmware, cloud-native infrastructure, and device interoperability. This is a high-impact role where your decisions will shape our platform architecture and directly influence real-world clinical outcomes.

We offer an environment that values technical ownership, innovation, and cross-functional learning, with opportunities to grow into broader leadership roles in a growing team.  


**Application**  


Applications will be reviewed continually, and we therefore recommend sending us your application as soon as possible, but no later than 25.09.01.  


We kindly ask you to submit your application in our recruitment system by clicking the “apply now” button. Due to GDPR regulations we do not accept applications via e-mail.  


If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Hiring Manager Ayodeji Ayibiowu at ayodeji.ayibiowu@getinge.com or Recruiter Frida Svensson at Frida.svensson@getinge.com.  


We look forward to receiving your application. We hope you will join us on our journey to become the world’s most desired MedTech company.  

**About us**With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.  


Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
company_description: Getinge is a global leading supplier of innovative medtech products and solutions within healthcare and life science.

title: Application Integration Specialist
description:
*At Benifex, we’re on a mission to revolutionize employee benefits and engagement. Born from the merger of Benify and Benefex, we’ve combined forces to build remarkable experiences that employees love. With 1,200+ Benifexers across 14 global offices, we partner with 3,000 customers in 120+ countries, supporting 5 million users worldwide . Ready to be part of an exciting journey ahead? Welcome to Benifex!*



Are you passionate about building seamless technical solutions and ensuring smooth data flows? Join Benifex as an Application Integration Specialist, where you’ll help connect systems, applications, and processes across our international organization.  

  

As an Application Integration Specialist, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, and maintenance of integrations between various software systems. Your work ensures data consistency, accuracy, and reliability, and directly contributes to the successful launch and maintenance of our client solutions.


This position requires a strong technical foundation, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. You’ll be part of a team of Application Integration Specialists based in both Sweden and Lithuania, working cross-functionally within a squad that operates in sprints.  

  

**In this role** **you will:**

* Configure, customize, and develop integrations using the Benifex platform, APIs, web services, and tools like Node-RED.
* Scope, implement, and troubleshoot data transfers between systems.
* Test integrations to ensure functionality and quality.
* Collaborate with internal teams and third-party vendors to ensure successful deployments.
* Maintain and improve integration solutions.
  
* 

**Personal attributes**  

You enjoy working across teams and get energy from translating technical needs into scalable integration solutions. We’re looking for someone who thrives in a role with multiple points of contact, working closely with stakeholders across teams, both locally and internationally.


**We also see that you have**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Fundamental understanding of Object-Oriented Programming (e.g., Java, C++, .NET).
* Proficiency in integration technologies, APIs, web services, and messaging protocols (e.g., SOAP, REST).
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Professional proficiency in English, both spoken and written.

**It's a , thus not a requirement if you also got...**

  

* Hands-on experience with Node-RED or similar integration tools.
* Knowledge of Single Sign-On (SSO) protocols and standards, and the ability to integrate applications with SSO solutions.
* Knowledge of project management methodologies and the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple integration projects simultaneously.

**Perks of being a Benifexer**

* Collective agreement
* Wellness allowance of 4000 SEK ‍️
* 30 vacation days ️
* ITP1 pension
* Lifeplan - a leading financial advisory service that offers personalized advice for maximizing your pension savings
* A variety of social events and activities at our offices
* Hybrid working - minimum 3 days/week from the office.


As a Benifexer, you'll enjoy a forward-thinking culture that encourages personal and professional growth. We offer an entrepreneurial environment that values creativity and new ideas, with a commitment to diversity and inclusion. With a nearly gender-balanced team, we prioritize creating a supportive workplace where everyone can thrive.

**Practical information**  

**Start:** August/September  

**Extent:** Full-time, 100%  

**Location:** Gothenburg or Stockholm

  

Apply by submitting your CV and/or your LinkedIn profile using the application form below. We screen applications continuously and may hire someone before the last application date.

*Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments for interviews by replying to the email you will receive after you apply.*

title: IT Support Manager (Consultant)
description:
**Position Summary** 




 Everything we do at Samsung is driven by an unyielding passion for excellence—and an unfaltering commitment to develop the best products and services on the market. In today’s fast-paced global economy, change is constant and innovation is critical to a company’s survival. As we have done for over 80 years, we set our sights on the future, anticipating market needs and demands so we can steer our company toward long-term success. As our IT Support Manager, you will have an integral part in ensuring we stay on top of the market and continue to enrich and simplify the consumers’ lives.
 



  





 Samsung continues to grow and is now looking for an IT Support Manager for our IT Support Team. In this role, you will be responsible for successfully operating and developing the Nordic IT support organization of Samsung Electronics with a clear service-oriented approach.
 



 You and your team of 5 work from the IT Support helpdesk in the Kista Office, covering the Nordics. You report to Eric Himberg, our Head of Process Innovation.
 



 You will be hired as a consultant through a consultancy agency, working full-time for Samsung.
 



  





**Role And Responsibilities** 




 The IT Support Manager will play a critical role in ensuring the smooth operation and development of the Nordic IT support organization at Samsung Electronics. This hands-on position focuses on delivering IT services with a strong emphasis on operational excellence and direct engagement with the team and stakeholders, while also incorporating strategic elements to align with broader organizational goals.
 



 Key responsibilities include:
 


* Assessment and Improvement of IT Infrastructure & Services: Evaluate current IT systems and services to identify areas for enhancement and ensure alignment with business needs, guided by strategic frameworks from the head office and Europe office.
* Operational Leadership of IT Support Organization: Oversee the IT support team, manage skill sets, and ensure efficient daily operations to meet stakeholder expectations, while adhering to organizational standards and priorities.
* Implementation of IT Services: Develop and deploy IT solutions tailored to the organization’s needs, ensuring they are practical, cost-effective, and aligned with business goals while adhering to strategic guidelines set by the head office and Europe office.
* IT Security Management: Ensure system and data security compliance with regulatory requirements, such as NIS2, and actively defend against external threats, all while maintaining alignment with global security policies.
* Budget and Resource Management: Manage the annual IT budget, optimize resource allocation, and ensure IT investments align with operational priorities, in line with the strategic financial frameworks defined by the head office and Europe office.
* Vendor and Contract Management: Oversee relationships with service providers, suppliers, and mobile communication operators to ensure seamless IT operations, ensuring compliance with procurement policies and contractual standards set by the head office and Europe office.
* Process Innovation: Collaborate with internal stakeholders to drive process improvements and support organizational objectives through IT-related project management, ensuring initiatives are aligned with broader strategic goals and operational priorities defined by the head office and Europe office.
* Adoption of New Technologies: Leverage emerging technologies such as AI, Cloud (SaaS), RPA, and Data Warehousing to enhance organizational capabilities and operational efficiency, while ensuring alignment with the strategic technology roadmap set by the head office and Europe office.



  





**Main Areas of Responsibility** 



* IT Resource Management: Operate and develop the Nordic IT organization with clear roles and responsibilities to meet stakeholder needs, ensuring alignment with organizational standards.
* IT Budget Management: Manage the annual IT budget as part of the corporate management plan and ensure alignment with IT strategy, guided by financial frameworks from the head office and Europe office.
* Process Innovation: Drive innovation in collaboration with internal stakeholders and head office to support organizational targets through IT-related projects, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
* IT & Data Security: Establish and maintain IT security measures in compliance with relevant laws and regulations, including NIS2. Support IRP registration processes and audits, while adhering to global security policies.
* Contract Management: Manage contracts with service providers, suppliers, and mobile communication operators to ensure optimal IT operations, in line with procurement policies and contractual standards.
* New Technology Adoption: Actively integrate new technologies such as AI, Cloud (SaaS), RPA, and Data Warehousing to strengthen organizational capabilities, ensuring alignment with the strategic technology roadmap



  





**Skills And Qualifications** 




**Education and Professional Experience** 



* Minimum 5 years of professional experience in a comparable role or technical consulting company at a management level.
* Minimum 10 years of experience in IT project implementation, delivery, and operational management, preferably in a consulting role.
* In-depth understanding of stakeholder and internal customer needs.
* Industry experience in electronics and consumer goods.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering, Information Systems, Business Information Systems, or a related field.



**Technical Skills** 



* Expertise in designing future-state IT organizations with a focus on operational efficiency.
* Strong methodological skills in problem-solving, idea generation, and project management.
* Proficiency in IT systems and infrastructure (e.g., SAP, BI tools like Power BI, Qlik, Tabular, Cloud platforms like Azure, Salesforce.com, RPA solutions).
* Background in deploying IT systems and planning implementations.
* In-depth understanding of data analysis, budgeting, and business operations.
* Knowledge of cross-functional IT structures, legal and compliance topics.



**Personal Skills** 



* Strong customer orientation and service mindset.
* Superior analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
* Excellent organizational and leadership skills.
* Strong stakeholder communication skills across organizational functions and management levels.
* Fluent in English (written & spoken); Scandinavian or Korean fluency is advantageous.



  





 This role requires a hands-on approach to managing IT operations while ensuring alignment with organizational goals and delivering value through practical IT solutions, all within the strategic framework defined by the head office and Europe office.
 



  





 Selection and interview process is ongoing; please apply as soon as possible. As mentioned,
 **You will be hired as a consultant through a consultancy agency, working full-time for Samsung.** 
 We look forward to getting your application!
 



**Samsung Fast Facts** 




**#DoWhatYouCant** 




  





**All information shared during the recruitment process will be handled with strict confidentiality, any trade secrets or proprietary details will be protected in accordance with applicable laws and company policies.** 



* Please visit Samsung membership to see Privacy Policy, which defaults according to your location, at: https://account.samsung.com/membership/policy/privacy. You can change Country/Language at the bottom of the page. If you are European Economic Resident, please click here: https://europe-samsung.com/ghrp/PrivacyNoticeforEU.html

title: Data Analyst
description:
Data Analyst
 



  





 Whitehall Resources currently require an experienced Data Analyst to work with a key client based in Sweden
 



  





 Your areas of responsibility will include but not be limited to:
 



 - Analyse existing KYC data to identify gaps, inconsistencies, and areas for improvement
 



 - Work collaboratively with business and IT partners across business units to develop and implement data standards to ensure data accuracy & completeness
 



 - Be part of major projects for delivery of Group KYC Tool
 



 - Partner with Data Architects and business SMEs to create and maintain a Business Information Model (BIM) for each data domain that is aligned across the enterprise
 



 - Monitor data quality metrics and report on findings to management
 



 - Investigate and resolve data quality issues, escalating complex problems as needed
 



 - Provide consultative services to agile delivery teams and ensure data governance best practices
 



 - Support the implementation of new KYC systems and processes, ensuring data migration and integration are seamless and accurate
 



 - Utilize enterprise approved tools to develop reproducible data-flows that ultimately fulfill reporting requirements
 



 - Implement testing and monitor quality of developed data-flows and reporting outputs, performing upgrades as identified and maintenance as required
 



 - Work with multiple customers to analyze and visualize complex data in simple and accurate ways
 



 - Document data definitions, data lineage, and data quality rules
 



 - Participate in data governance/stewardship communities of practice
 



 - Contribute to the development and maintenance of data governance policies and procedures
 



 - Stay up-to-date with industry best practices and regulatory requirements related to KYC data management
 



 - Proactively identify opportunities to improve data quality and efficiency
 



  





 Must-have knowledge and experience
 



 - Proven experience in data management, data quality, or a related role, preferably within the financial services industry
 



 - Experience with advanced SQL queries and familiarity with another programming language, e.g. Python, R, Java and Scala
 



 - Familiar with data taxonomy and capable to build small data models
 



 - Experience with Power BI to produce reports
 



 - Excellent stakeholder management is mandatory as you will be working closely with multiple business areas and key business leads across IT, Architecture, Financial Crime, Compliance, Legal - and the Business in order to implement changes
 



 - Experience within financial crime (AML/CTF, KYC, Transaction Monitoring and Sanctions), working agile and experience with SAFe is an advantage
 



 - Professional, organised, and structured in approach and work produced to a high quality of standard, and you always strive to find the solution that is best for the bank
 



 - Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, strong attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy
 



 - Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences
 



 - Experience with data governance frameworks and methodologies is a plus
 



 - Experience with data migration and integration projects is a plus
 



 - Ability to work independently and as part of a team
 



 - Fluency in English is a requirement (speaking and writing)

title: Technical Team Lead

description:

title: Senior Security Engineer - Network Security
description:
**Job Description**
 Join our Cyber Security Engineering unit, where innovation and security drive us. We are transforming technology with modern Network Security, integrations and cloud services. We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced
 **Senior Cyber Security Engineer** 
 to join our
 **Network Security** 
 Engineering team. This role involves architecting, designing, implementing, and maintaining robust security measures to protect our global network infrastructure. The ideal candidate will blend theoretical knowledge with hands-on expertise. This role requires a deep understanding of cybersecurity principles, Network Security technologies, and the ability to collaborate across multiple globally dispersed stakeholders and teams.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Lead design efforts for new and upgraded Network Security solutions across various physical sites (branches, stores, data centers). Support business initiatives by incorporating new functions and services
* Develop, manage, and modernize the Network Security, transitioning from legacy systems to a modern SSE and ZTNA solutions
* Ensure adherence to architectural policies and guidelines, aligning network design with the established roadmap, and implementing best practices for overall Network Security engineering
* Create and maintain roadmaps, policies and implementation plans, analyzing, designing, and evolving Network Security infrastructure to meet evolving business needs
* Ensure Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability of H&M Global Network
* Oversee performance, availability, and reliability of the Network Security, conducting monitoring activities and implementing necessary improvements
* Advise on Network Security design, collaborate with stakeholders to align solutions with business objectives, and recommend innovative security measures to support company growth
* Set and maintain Network Security standards to uphold security, quality and efficiency across all network deployments
* Design, configure and install Network Security devices and solution (firewalls, gateways, proxies, load balancers, reverse-proxy, VPN, QoS, IDS, NAC etc.) both on-prem as in the cloud (Azure, GCP)
* Provide Level-3 support and troubleshooting using tools like Wireshark and NetFlow
* Ensuring compliance towards external and internal Security standards (ISO, NIST, etc.)
* Coordinate and manage major and high priority incidents
* Take ownership and end to end responsibility for the solutions/functions within product team
* Protect H&M Group technical assets, including data, network systems, and solutions, against advanced persistent cyber and information security threats such as hacking, malware and ransomware, and cybercrime (on-prem and in the cloud)
* Understand and mitigate security vulnerabilities in various software and hardware designs


**Qualifications**
**WHO YOU ARE**
* Strong understanding of IP networking and protocols, including IPSEC, HSRP, BGP, OSPF, 802.11, and QoS
* Expert in Network Security solutions and products provided by Cisco, HP Aruba, Zscaler and Citrix NetScaler (proven by certificates)
* Extensive experience with Network Security products and capabilities, including IDS/IPS, proxies, firewalls, reverse-proxies, load balancing, segmentation, VPNs, SIEM, XDR, SSE, SASE, SWG, CASB, ZTNA, and 802.1x
* Experience in network defense mechanisms (incl. identity and access management)
* Perform network scanning, packet collection, and manage certificates
* Security Architecture, Design and Threat Modelling
* Cybersecurity capabilities
* Hardening
* Log management
* Vulnerability analysis and IT-system reviews
* Information flows and key assets
* Rules, policies, routines and guardrails
* Understand regulatory and compliance requirements (GDPR, PCI-DSS, Schrems, etc.)
* Hands-on experience with network diagnostic tools (e.g., Wireshark, NetFlow)
* Expertise in cloud networking and security (e.g., Azure and GCP)
* Proficiency in network troubleshooting and automation (e.g., scripting with Python)
* Experience with DevOps methodology and tools
* Experience from large enterprise networks and or ISP/Telco domain
* Independent problem-solving, addressing complex security challenges with minimal supervision
* English proficiency


**We prefer that you also possess the following:**
* CCNP (Security) or higher certifications such as CCIE or CISSP are highly valued
* Security certifications (e.g., Security+, GCIA, GCIH, GREM, CISSP, CEH, GCFA, etc.)
* Azure Security Engineer, or GCP Security Engineer certification
* Solid understanding of the OSI/TCP/IP model
* Degree in Computer Science or related field
* Experience with Agile methodology and tools (e.g., Jira/Confluence)
* Knowledge of ServiceNow and network automation concepts


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: (Associate) IT Project Manager (IT Base and Platforms) – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services Directorate (GCS), Group Digital Office (GDO), Data and Information Solutions Department (DIS), at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an
 **(Associate) IT Project Manager (IT Base and Platforms)\*** 
**.**
**This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
*\*internal benchmark* 
*(Associate) Officer IT Applications*
*Panel interviews are foreseen as from July 2025*
 Purpose
   

  

 You will design, plan, coordinate, implement and report on IT Base and Platforms (IBP) Value Chain projects in line with business needs and the EIB Digital transformation Programme, with a view of promoting a digital workplace at the EIB and to achieve the agreed project/program results.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 The IT Base and Platforms PMO reports directly to the Head of Department.
   

  

 This position works in liaison with the other team members in the department, particularly those involved in the IBP stream governance. In the incumbent also has extensive contacts with members of the Platforms & Services Department, representatives from Business Solutions Department and other divisions in GDO.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Take project management responsibilities for assigned IT projects (mainly, from the IT Base and Platforms (IBP) Value Stream), coordination, scheduling and implementation of new or enhanced software applications with business users and other IT technical teams to ensure the completion of project within set time, budget and quality objectives.
* Support the IBP Steering Committee in the implementation of the governance defined for the stream.
* Coordinate the preparation of IBP meetings and organise discussions between Value Chains technical leads and IBP leads to prepare the actions and decisions for the IBP Steering Committee.
* Guide the IBP Steering Committee in refining, prioritising and planning the requests in the backlog.
* Compile status reports from flagships and key transversal initiatives (e.g.: M365 programme, cloud journey)
* Monitor and report progress of KPIs defined for IT strategy pillars.
* Monitor and report the assignment of IBP budget envelope and its consumption.
* Maintain and track the pipeline of requests received across the demand management tool, following the guidance of Head of Divisions, Head of Units or other key members of IBP Stream.
* Organise and develop the capacity planning enabling prioritisation of requests within the stream.
* Help IBP Steering Committee members to detect critical services and associated pain points and risks and guide them to adopt new ways of working created by the new delivery model.
* Provide support on communication around the committee and its achievements, at programme level as well as to senior management and EIB Group staff.
* Work closely with DTO’s Project Management Office and provide input for improvement on the demand management, capacity, and project management tools.
* Participate in Bank-wide initiatives, representing own domain, or in Department-wide initiatives, representing own domain for GCS-GDO.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in preferably in computer science or related discipline
* At least 3 years work experience in roles related to the Project Management / PMO / Portfolio Demand Management, preferably related to IT
* Good project management and stakeholder management skills
* Experience working in multicultural teams with various technical and functional backgrounds would be an advantage
* Excellent communication and organisation skills, with ability to influence stakeholders and partners
* Understanding of the banking activities and operational processes is considered as an advantage.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*) with a good command of the other. (Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage).


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

*This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.*

title: Service Manager,  Connectivity & Office IT
description:
****THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL****
**Vend** 
 is home to the most trusted and visited online marketplaces in the Nordics – including
 **FINN (** 
 Norway),
 **Blocket** 
 (Sweden),
 **DBA** 
 and
 **Bilbasen** 
 (Denmark), and
 **Tori** 
 and
 **Oikotie** 
 (Finland). Every day, we help millions of people make life-changing decisions to buy, sell, hire, or get hired by creating trusted matches through smart technology, strong brands, and deep local expertise.
   

  

 We’re excited to expand our team and are looking for a skilled Service Manager - Connectivity & Office IT. You’ll join Enterprise Operations, with the mission to provide innovative and secure IT Solutions to the employees and functions of Vend.
   

  

 As a Service Manager - Connectivity & Office IT, your mission is to bring Vend employees together by enabling seamless interaction and collaboration across multiple countries. The Service area includes secure and reliable solutions for; Connectivity, Video conference, Roombooking, Office Printers etc.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Ensure Operational Excellence: Responsible for the infrastructure, integrations and security for the solutions in scope.
* IT Service Management: We operate in an agile way and facilitate backlog management, ensuring transparency and collaboration.
* Stakeholder Engagement, strategic planning and development. Close collaboration with the business stakeholders and process owners to make sure that the Service Strategy, roadmap and architecture maximise business value.
* Financial control, compliance and governance: Vendor collaboration, procurement, license management. Manage system costs, monitor budget, including cost allocation. Ensure compliance with Vend policies and guidelines as well as government regulations f.ex GDPR and NIS2
* People management and leadership: As a manager for a small but great team across the nordics you are responsible for employee growth, development and engagement.


**WHO ARE YOU?**
 You naturally create structure and drive progress toward clear goals. You’re driven to grow both people and operations, and thrive in dynamic, change-oriented environments.
   

  

* You have an academic education or equivalent experience, with at least 4-5 years of work experience in leadership positions as well as managing IT applications or other relevant areas.
* You possess a broad and solid foundation in IT, with hands-on experience in network operations and audiovisual (AV) technology.
* You have a genuine passion for technology and enjoy engaging with people, building strong relationships and you have a solution oriented approach.
* You are proactive and curious, always keen to explore emerging technologies and identify practical ways they can create value. When challenges arise, you’re not afraid to roll up your sleeves—diving into root cause analysis and troubleshooting to find effective solutions.
* ITIL certification as well as Agile experience is an advantage.
* Fluent in English: You master English fluently in both speaking and writing. Knowing Swedish and or Norwegian is an advantage.
* Some travel across our Nordic markets shall be expected as part of collaboration with local teams and our business areas.


**What We Offer**
* A key role in a strong and collaborative Enterprise Operations unit
* High degree of responsibility from day one, with continuous opportunities for learning and development
* A hybrid work setup and centrally located offices in Oslo/Stockholm
* Competitive compensation and benefits
* A people-first company culture built on trust, curiosity, and impact.


**GOT YOUR ATTENTION?** 
 Let us hear from you!
   

  

 Apply by
 **15th August 2025.** 
 We’ll begin reviewing applications on a rolling basis, but the process the applications post
 **15th August 2025**
**QUESTIONS?**
**Katarina Rustas,** 
 Head of Group & Business Solutions, is happy to share more about the team, projects, or day-to-day work. Best reached at katarina.rustas@vend.com. For recruitment-related questions, please contact
 **Clayton Don Corda,** 
 Senior Talent Acquisition Partner at clayton.don.corda@vend.com

title: About the Role
description:
**About The Role**
 In this position, you will be responsible for coordinating and overseeing test execution across multiple phases within a large-scale logistics project focused on warehouse operations. You will ensure that all testing activities are planned, structured, and executed in close collaboration with internal teams, external vendors, and business stakeholders.
   

  

 You will manage several test phases concurrently, maintaining efficiency and quality throughout. A key part of your role will be to align with relevant stakeholders, ensuring clear communication, shared expectations, and smooth progress across all test-related workstreams.
   

  

 You will continuously monitor testing activities, analyze results, and provide regular updates on progress to ensure transparency and facilitate informed decision-making.
   

  

**Required Skills And Experience**
* Solid understanding of warehouse logistics and supply chain processes
* Proven experience in test management, including collaboration with external vendors and automation solution providers
* Good knowledge of software product development and delivery cycles
* Excellent communication skills and fluency in English, both spoken and written


**About Rasulson Consulting**
 Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Cisco Certified Network Engineer
description:
Job Title: Cisco Certified Network Engineer
 



 Location: Malmö, Stockholm, MOLNDAL, NACKA, NORRKOEPING
 



 Job Type: Part-time
 



 Industry: IT / Networking / Telecommunications
 



  





 About the Role:
 



 We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Cisco Certified Network Engineer to join our IT infrastructure team in Sweden. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, managing, and troubleshooting enterprise-level network systems using Cisco technologies.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities:
 



  




* Design, configure, and maintain LAN, WAN, and wireless networks.
* Implement and manage Cisco routers, switches, firewalls, and other network devices.
* Monitor network performance, availability, and security using industry-standard tools.
* Perform network troubleshooting and diagnostics to resolve issues quickly and efficiently.
* Work with cross-functional teams to implement new IT solutions or resolve complex technical challenges.
* Ensure network integrity and security through best practices, including firewall management, access control, and VPN implementation.
* Maintain network documentation and prepare technical reports as needed.
* Participate in on-call rotations and provide support during network outages or upgrades.



  





 Required Qualifications:
 



  




* Active Cisco Certification (CCNA, CCNP, or higher – required)
* Hands-on experience in server parts replacement.
* Proficiency with Cisco hardware and software (IOS, ASA, Nexus, Meraki, etc.).
* Strong understanding of network protocols (TCP/IP, BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, MPLS).
* Experience with network monitoring tools such as SolarWinds, PRTG, or Wireshark.
* Strong troubleshooting skills.
* Good written and verbal communication skills in English.

title: Investment & Corporate Banking – Analyst, Stockholm
Windows/Mac Client & System Engineer
description:
Nordnet is a leading pan-Nordic digital platform for savings and investments. Ever since we started in 1996, our purpose has been to democratize savings and investments. Through innovation, simplicity, and transparency, we challenge traditional ways in the financial industry, and give private savers access to the same information, tools and services as professionals. Our ambition is to inspire, encourage and enable people to take their savings to the next level, no matter who they are.
   

  

*Help us transform the way people save and invest. Become a part of journey to build an inspiring and innovative platform for savers and investors in the Nordics. Here's your opportunity!*
**In brief**
 We are looking for a Senior Windows/Mac Client & System Engineer to join Nordnets IT Support department. We currently have 5 engineers working in the team and are now looking for one more, with mainly Windows competence.
   

  

 IT Support's mission is twofolded
   

  

* Provide prompt and effective assistance to Nordnet personnel with IT equipment and software-related inquiries and issues.
* Proactively maintain the integrity, functionality, and security of client devices, mobile phones, meeting room equipment, and associated software, ensuring adherence to Nordnet's stringent security standards.


 IT Operations is comprised of various teams, and you will collaborate closely with them to effectively manage problems and drive progress on ongoing initiatives and projects.
   

  

**This is you**
 Most likely, you have a technical background that enables you to understand IT services on a deeper level. You have a strong passion for customer satisfaction. You like to communicate, and you have a true interest in building relations and creating result through your team.
   

  

 You should have several years of experience working with Clients (Mac/Win & Mobiles).
   

  

 Good knowledge of
   

  

* SCCM
* Intune
* Azure
* Jamf
* Google workspace


 You have an open mindset and a can-do attitude. Getting to know the details and understanding how everything is connected and dependent on each other is of great importance to you. You’re not afraid of rolling up your sleeves and love working in a fast-paced environment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Client OS Configuration and deployment of Clients (Win/Mac & Mobile).
* Provide technical support to users and troubleshoot problems related to these clients.
* Deploy and manage software updates
* Troubleshoot hardware and software problems
* Document system configurations and procedures


 Former experience within Client OS Configuration is considered a huge advantage.
   

  

**About Nordnetters**
 We value experimentation and continuous improvement. With an impartial approach, we welcome new ideas to boost our progress. Sharing knowledge and learning from our setbacks is part of the game. We have the courage to ask questions and admit that we do not have the answer, all the time. We believe that straightforward and transparent communication build trust and inclusion.
   

  

 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We offer you the opportunity to work in a great team within a friendly Nordic environment with a strong focus on innovation, product development and technology. We are proud of the friendly and humble environment and commit to our goals as a team.
   

  

 We are 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen.
   

  

 You can also visit us on: www.nordnet.se, www.nordnet.no, www.nordnet.dk and www.nordnet.fi.
   

  

**Application**
 If you have questions, please contact Head of IT-Support, Patrik Axelsson, patrik.axelsson@nordnet.se
   

  

 Apply today– Due to summer vacation we will start to review applications in the beginning of August and will get back to you with feedback as soon as possible. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.
   

  

 We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Segment & Automation Specialist
description:
**Job Description**
 We are seeking a
 **Segment & Automation Specialist** 
 to join our global marketing analytics team at H&M. This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of data, technology, and customer experience. You’ll be responsible for building and managing customer segmentation strategies and marketing automation workflows that power personalized, data-driven campaigns across multiple channels.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Segment & Automation Specialist, you will play a central role in how we activate customer data across our marketing ecosystem. Your key responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Develop and maintain customer audiences to support targeted marketing and CRM initiatives.
* Design, implement, and optimize marketing automation workflows to improve campaign efficiency and personalization.
* Manage audience selection and activation within the Customer Data Platform (CDP).
* Provide training and ongoing support to global and regional teams to ensure effective use of segmentation and automation tools.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including CRM, media, product, and analytics to align segmentation strategies with business goals.
* Monitor and analyze campaign performance, using insights and test & learn capabilities to refine segmentation and automation strategies to optimize ROI.
* Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and internal data governance standards.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 In this role, you’ll be part of the Measurement & Analytics team within the Marketing function and work closely with a wide range of stakeholders across the organization. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams within the marketing unit—including CRM, media operations, strategy and planning, controlling, and technical product teams—to ensure that segmentation and automation strategies are aligned with business goals and deliver measurable impact. Together, you’ll drive insights and execution that enhance marketing activations.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**WHO YOU ARE**
* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Analytics, Data Science, or a related field.
* 3–5 years of experience in CRM, marketing automation, or customer analytics.
* Hands-on experience with data activation tools (e.g., Hightouch) and marketing automation platforms (e.g., Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Adobe Campaign, Braze), with a strong understanding of how to connect data to customer experiences
* Strong analytical skills and proficiency in tools such as SQL, Excel, or Google Analytics.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Experience supporting or training teams across different regions is a plus.
* A collaborative team player with a proactive mindset and a passion for customer-centric marketing in a fast-paced, global environment.


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.


**JOIN US**
 This is a permanent position based in Stockholm.
   

  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 \*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Projektledare IT – Införande av händelserapporteringssystem
description:
Vi söker en erfaren och engagerad IT-projektledare till ett uppdrag med fokus på att leda införandet av ett händelserapporteringssystem inom en samhällsviktig verksamhet. Rollen kräver en person med god balans mellan strategiskt tänkande och ett praktiskt, operativt arbetssätt. Du kommer att ha ett helhetsansvar för projektets genomförande – från planering till uppföljning och leverans.
   

  

**Om uppdraget**
 Som projektledare kommer du att ansvara för hela projektets livscykel och säkerställa att projektet når sina mål vad gäller tid, budget och kvalitet. Rollen innebär att driva projektet framåt, hantera risker och förändringar, samt säkerställa att tydlig kommunikation sker mellan projektets olika intressenter. Du fungerar även som stöd till förvaltningsledare inom flera IT-relaterade områden, där förvaltningsstöd och kontinuerlig förbättring är centralt.
   

  

 Uppdraget är mångfacetterat och ställer krav på både god teknisk förståelse och dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta i strukturerade och reglerade miljöer.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Leda och följa upp projektets alla faser – från initiering till avslut
* Ansvara för projektstyrning, rapportering, riskhantering och uppföljning
* Samverka med verksamhet, styrgrupp, tekniska specialister och andra intressenter
* Säkerställa att projektet levererar enligt uppsatta mål och krav
* Identifiera förbättringsmöjligheter och etablera effektiva rutiner
* Stötta andra förvaltningsledare IT i relaterade förvaltningsområden


**Kvalifikationer (ska-krav)**
* Erfarenhetsnivå: Nivå 4 (9–12 års relevant erfarenhet)
* Dokumenterad bakgrund inom projektledning, förändringsledning och processutveckling
* Kunskap eller praktisk erfarenhet av händelserapporteringssystem och tillhörande processer (exempelvis Centuri eller motsvarande)
* God analytisk förmåga och strukturerad arbetsmetodik
* Förmåga att kommunicera tydligt med både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska i både tal och skrift


**Meriterande (bör-krav)**
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom IT-förvaltning och ledning av förvaltningsområden
* Kunskap om etablerade ramverk såsom pm3 och ITIL
* Certifiering inom projektledning (t.ex. PMP, PRINCE2 eller likvärdigt)
* Tidigare erfarenhet från uppdrag inom offentlig sektor


**Referenskrav**
 Två Relevanta Referenser Krävs, Vilka Ska Kunna Styrka Konsultens Förmåga Att Framgångsrikt Driva Komplexa IT-projekt. Referenserna Ska Inkludera
   

  

* Organisation och kort beskrivning av uppdraget
* Namn och titel på referensperson
* Kontaktuppgifter (telefon och e-post)


**Uppdragsinformation**
* Plats: Stockholm
* Arbetsform: På plats med möjlighet till visst distansarbete efter överenskommelse
* Omfattning: 100 %
* Uppdragsperiod: Start efter avtal – 6 månader med eventuell förlängningsoption


**Om Rasulson Consulting**
 Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Creator Partner Manager
description:
Are you passionate about the creator world and excited to help shape the future of video and audio on Spotify? We’re looking for a Creator Partner Manager to build strong relationships with both up-and-coming and established creators across the Nordics – with a strong focus on video.
   

  

 You’ll be part of our Nordic podcast team and play a key role in helping creators grow, reach new audiences, and earn from their content – with Spotify as a key platform for distribution and creator tools.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Develop and lead strategies to engage local video creators and show them why Spotify is the best place to build their brand
* Help discover and support new podcast voices by building strong networks and partnerships
* Work closely with creators and their teams to get them set up on Spotify and make the most of our tools
* Collaborate with teams across Spotify – including business development, marketing, analytics, operations and more – to bring extra value to creators
* Plan and support creator events, masterclasses and training sessions across the region
* Be an expert on Spotify’s creator and monetization tools – and know how to match the right features to each creator’s goals


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have experience working with video creators – whether on a platform, in creator management, or within the broader content industry.
* You’re great at building relationships and developing partnerships at scale
* You know how to turn insights and data into action.
* You understand the global creator space – and the unique opportunities and challenges for creators in the Nordic market
* A go-getter who can make things happen, is comfortable taking the initiative and leading through influence
* You’re comfortable working with a range of internal and external stakeholders and can build trust across the board
* You’re a natural collaborator and enjoy working cross-functionally at all levels of the organisation and industry to make things happen.
* You’re a passionate explorer of digital culture, with a love for creators and content across platforms, podcasts, video, and everything in between.
* Fluent in Swedish


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in-person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Supportkonsult
description:
Vill du kombinera teknisk nyfikenhet, servicekänsla och kundfokus i en roll där du verkligen gör skillnad? Nu söker Legalsense en supportkonsult till vårt team i Sverige. Detta är en ny och viktig roll där du får vara med och bidra till vår fortsatta tillväxtresa på den nordiska marknaden.
 



  
 



**Om rollen** 




 Som supportkonsult hos oss på Legalsense blir du den andra medarbetaren i vårt svenska team – och samtidigt en del av vårt erfarna supportteam med utgångspunkt i Nederländerna. Tillsammans är supportteamet den första kontaktpunkten för våra kunder när det gäller frågor, incidenter och support kopplat till vår webbaserade programvara för advokatbyråer.
 



  





 Du hanterar ärenden för både svenska och internationella kunder, med särskilt fokus på användarna i Norden. Ärendena kommer in via telefon, e-post och vår digitala ärendeportal. Med hjälp av din analytiska förmåga och nyfikenhet ställer du rätt frågor, identifierar problem och hittar lösningar så att ärendena hanteras effektivt och korrekt.
 



  





 Utöver supportarbetet är du även delaktig i att implementera Legalsense hos nya kunder, vilket innebär att du får vara med från början, påverka hur vi arbetar och spela en central roll i vår fortsatta tillväxtresa i Norden.
 



  





**Viktiga ansvarsområden** 




 ·      Hantera supportärenden enligt SLA
 



 ·      Bidra till starka kundrelationer och en smidig användarupplevelse
 



 ·      Identifiera förbättringar och underhålla vår knowledgebase
 



 ·      Hålla i utbildningar, digitalt och på plats
 



 ·      Implementering av Legalsense hos nya kunder
 



 ·      Dokumentera lösningar och förenkla kundens vardag
 



  
 



**Om dig** 




 ·      Du är nyfiken, ansvarstagande och har ett starkt servicefokus
 



 ·      Du har ett proaktivt förhållningssätt till kunder och är service- och resultatinriktad
 



 ·      Du kommunicerar väl, på såväl svenska som på engelska
 



 ·      Du har god analytisk förmåga, är tekniskt nyfiken och lär dig gärna nya system
 



 ·      Tidigare erfarenhet av support, advokatbranschen eller teknisk felsökning är meriterande
 



 ·      Erfarenhet av SQL och HTML är ett plus, men inget krav
 



  
 



**Om oss** 




 Legalsense är en ledande leverantör av ett webbaserat ärendehanteringssystem (SaaS) för advokatbyråer och jurister. Med huvudkontor i Utrecht, Nederländerna, är vi väletablerade på den europeiska marknaden och har i dag cirka 30 svenska kunder – med målet att bli många fler. Vårt team består av cirka 25 medarbetare med högt engagemang, stark teknisk kompetens och en vilja att hjälpa våra kunder till framgång. Även om vi arbetar från olika platser är vi ett sammansvetsat team där samarbete och gemenskap är en naturlig del av vardagen. Vi har dagliga digitala check-ins i våra respektive team, veckovisa möten med hela företaget och flera återkommande aktiviteter varje år där alla medarbetare samlas på vårt huvudkontor i Nederländerna.
 



  
 



**Vi erbjuder** 




 ·      En nyckelroll i vårt svenska team – med stor möjlighet att påverka
 



 ·      Konkurrenskraftig lön och goda anställningsförmåner
 



 ·      Generösa möjligheter till distansarbete
 



 ·      En vänlig och inkluderande arbetskultur med högt förtroende
 



 ·      Möjligheter till personlig utveckling, utbildning och långsiktig karriär
 



 ·      Ett internationellt företag med stora framtidsplaner
 



  
 



**Praktisk information** 




 Omfattning: Heltid
 



 Placering: Stockholm, med möjlighet till hybridarbete
 



 Start: Så snart som möjligt
 



  
 



**Hur du ansöker** 




 Känner du igen dig i beskrivningen och blir nyfiken på Legalsense?
 



 Skicka då ditt CV och ett personligt brev (på engelska) till hettyfenton@legalsense.nl. Urval sker löpande.
 



  





 För eventuella frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten så tveka inte att höra av dig till Sara Söderman, sarasoderman@legalsense.nl eller via telefon +46706155888.
 



  
 



 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Director, Program Management
description:
At Cepheid, we are passionate about improving health care through fast, accurate diagnostic testing. Our mission drives us, every moment of every day, as we develop scalable, groundbreaking solutions to solve the world’s most complex health challenges. Our associates are involved in every stage of molecular diagnostics, from ideation to development and delivery of testing advancements that improve patient outcomes across a range of settings. As a member of our team, you can make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within an environment that fosters career growth and development.
   

  

 Cepheid is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Danaher Diagnostics companies. Together, we’re working at the pace of change on diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges, driven by knowing that behind every test there is a patient waiting.
   

  

 Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.
   

  

 The Director, Program Management is responsible for leading and managing programs from Innovation/NPD (New Product Development) to launch including market expansion/protection for assays/reagents developed out of Solna R&D.
   

  

 This position is part of the Technical Project Management and will be located in Solna. At Cepheid, our vision is to be the leading provider of seamlessly connected diagnostic solutions.
   

  

**In this role, you will have the opportunity to:**
* Manage the roadmap for the active and on deck programs
* Lead the cross-functional coordination of teams to ensure alignment and proper resourcing and prioritization of Solna R&D portfolio (innovation/NPD and market expansion/protection).
* Lead and drive on time delivery metric for Solna portfolio
* Define, measure, resolve, and communicate project progress to leadership
* Participate in development and continuous improvement on best practices for project execution and talent development for PMO including leading and driving Kaizens/workshops
* Support implementation of good / industry standard project management and processes
* Develop talent of direct reports and bench strength to build/sustain team capability to support current and future roadmap needs, aligned with business growth targets


**The essential requirements of the job include:**
* Bachelor’s degree required in Science, Engineering and/or Business Administration
* 8+ years of experience developing products in a regulated environment


**Travel, Motor Vehicle Record & Physical/Environment Requirements:**
* Ability to travel – 20% of time
* Ability to work in the evenings due to majority of stakeholders being located on the US West Coast


**It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:**
* Master’s /PHD Degree preferred
* PMP or PgMP certification is highly preferred
* Medical device and/or In Vitro Diagnostic product launch experience is highly preferred
* People Management background is a plus


 Cepheid, a Danaher operating company, offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to our lives. Whether it’s a health care program or paid time off, our programs contribute to life beyond the job. Check out our benefits at danaherbenefitsinfo.com.
   

  

 Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.
   

  

 For more information, visit www.danaher.com.
   

  

 At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

title: Solution Architect for API Solutions | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Shape the future of SEB's API platform as our next Solution Architect!
   

  

 SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you? About the role: As a Solution Architect in the API area, you’ll play a crucial role in building our API-driven platform and governance. You will contribute to the transformation of our API platforms, a highly prioritized area, ensuring seamless integrations for both our internal and external customers.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the architectural work within the API area.
* Mentor and guide development teams in adopting API standards and practices.
* Coordinate the architecture change agenda for API solutions in the Business Infrastructure domain.
* Support various API transition initiatives with your expertise and experience.
* Act as an advisor to stakeholders on both the business and technology sides.
* Drive innovation by designing scalable and secure API solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align API strategies with business goals.
