title: Licensing Manager, EU
description:
At Electrolux Group, as a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Electrolux is a major player when it comes to brand licensing, the second largest corporate brand licensing program worldwide, with an estimated global retail value of over USD $3.8 billion.
   

  

 Brand licensing provides an alternative business model to in-house manufacturing, sourcing products, or using subscription models. We currently license about 14 brands in our 70+ brand portfolio, including Electrolux, AEG, Frigidaire and Zanussi.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 The Licensing Manager will work with the existing Europe licensing partners to manage the product development and marketing process through brand training, approving all products and marketing materials, as well as working with a Licensing Agency to generate new licensing opportunities in Europe. This role requires a self-motivated individual with excellent follow-up and strong communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills. The Licensing Manager will need to build solid relationships with external partners and internal Electrolux Group stakeholders.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Work with the licensing agency to manage Europe licensees and help them grow their businesses
* Liaise and build relationships with key internal stakeholders including product line, legal, marketing, design, and licensing team colleagues in other countries
* Work with Head of Global Brand Licensing to manage the Licensing Agency relationship
* Provide day-to-day support on other general inquiries/ information requests from the Licensing Agency and Licensees
* Traffic brand licensing agreements and domain name agreements for signing to increase speed and efficiency
* Support and promote licensing program within Electrolux through events, outreach, and newsletter communications as well as external opportunities (industry awards, reviews of licensed products in the media, etc.)
* Work with internal system to monitor CSTAR of Europe licensees and share reporting with licensees
* Lead planning efforts for licensee summits


**Your Profile:**
* 5+ years of experience in licensing, consumer products, marketing, sales, or related field.
* Bachelors degree or equivalent.
* Strong communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills.
* The ability to communicate at all levels and to present to senior management concisely and with command of detail.
* Consumer focused with a drive to succeed.
* Strong organizational skills and detail oriented.
* Experience in managing product development processes and marketing initiatives, ideally with licensing experience preferred.


**What We Offer:**
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work environment.
* Extensive learning and development opportunities.
* Career mobility across functions and geographies.
* Discounts on Electrolux products and services.
* Family, health, and wellbeing support.
* Access to gym, pool, and other sport activities on-site.
* Comprehensive insurance plan.
* Additional holidays.


 Find out more: Electrolux Group: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/lifeatelectrolux Stockholm HQ: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/sweden

title: AREA SALES MANAGER MELLANSVERIGE - GARO
description:
**GARO är ett företag, som under eget varumärke, utvecklar och tillverkar innovativa produkter och system inom elinstallation och elbilsladdning. Med fokus på användarvänlighet, hållbarhet och design tar GARO ett tydligt helhetsansvar. Koncernen har ca 430 anställda med operativ verksamhet i Sverige, Norge, Finland, Irland, Polen, Storbritannien och Tyskland. Försäljningen är fördelad på affärsområdena GARO Electrification och GARO E-mobility. Huvudkontoret ligger i svenska Gnosjö. Produktionsenheter finns i Sverige och Polen. GARO är noterad på Nasdaq Stockholm OMX, Small Cap.
   

  

 Affärsidén är att ”med fokus på innovation, hållbarhet och design utvecklar GARO lönsamma helhetslösningar”.**
**ÄR DU REDO ATT DRIVA FÖRSÄLJNING OCH BYGGA RELATIONER I ETT EXPANSIVT FÖRETAG?**
**GARO söker en Area Sales Manager till Mellansverige**
 GARO är en ledande aktör inom elinstallationsmaterial och elbilsladdning. Vi utvecklar och tillhandahåller hållbara lösningar för framtidens elektrifiering. Nu söker vi en engagerad och affärsdriven Area Sales Manager som vill vara med och utveckla försäljningen av våra installationsprodukter och projektaffärer i Mellansverige. Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och bli en del av ett företag i förändring? Då kan det vara dig vi söker!
   

  

**ROLLEN**
 Som Area Sales Manager hos GARO Electrification får du ett självständigt och varierat arbete där du ansvarar för försäljning inom installation och projekt i Mellansverige – från Östergötland till Dalarna, Stockholmstrakten och Örebro. Du utgår från hemmet och reser regelbundet inom regionen för att möta kunder, installatörer och samarbetspartners.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar**
* Besök hos installatörer och industrikunder för produktpresentationer och teknisk rådgivning.
* Försäljning via personliga möten, telefon och digitala kanaler.
* Utveckling av projektaffärer och behovsanalys för optimal eldistribution.
* Samarbete med kollegor inom Area Sales samt Sales Support.


**VEM ÄR DU?**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har erfarenhet av extern försäljning, där du både har arbetat med att vårda befintliga kundrelationer och driva nykundsbearbetning. Du har slutfört gymnasieutbildning och har tidigare haft en roll där kommunikation och samarbete varit centrala delar. Du behöver också ha möjlighet att resa inom regionen, inklusive övernattningar, samt ha B-körkort.
   

  

 Det är viktigt att du har god IT-vana och känner dig bekväm med både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift. Har du dessutom en bakgrund inom el, exempelvis som elektriker, erfarenhet av försäljning av installationsprodukter, kunskap om upphandlingar och förhandlingar, eller förståelse för försäljning via grossister – då ser vi det som meriterande. Det är också en fördel om du har vana av att presentera produkter inför grupper.
   

  

 Du är en utåtriktad och målinriktad person med starkt kundfokus. Du har ett lyhört och representativt bemötande, är service-minded och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap. Du har lätt för att lära och trivs i en roll där du får vara både rådgivare och relationsbyggare.
   

  

**VARFÖR GARO?**
 GARO står mitt i en spännande förändringsfas med ett nytt ledarskap som fokuserar på delaktighet, samverkan och tydliga strategier. Du får arbeta i en organisation där människan står i centrum och där arbetsmiljön är hållbar och inkluderande. Vi erbjuder förmånsbil, 30 dagars semester, friskvårdsbidrag och stor frihet att planera din tid. Du får också möjlighet att vara med och påverka utvecklingen i ett företag som satsar på innovation, hållbarhet och mångfald.
   

  

**LÅTER DET INTRESSANT?**
 Skicka in din ansökan via www.fskpeople.se – vi arbetar med löpande urval.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering samarbetar GARO med FSK People.
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta P-A Karlsson - [email protected]

title: Project Lead Commercial Operations to Vitamin Well Group
description:
At
 **Vitamin Well Group,** 
 we provide great-tasting drinks, snacks, and protein products. Our brands Vitamin Well, NOCCO, and Barebells are available across most of Europe, North America, the MENA region, and parts of Asia Pacific. With a revenue of 650 million euros, we operate in over 40 markets, with headquarters in Stockholm and offices in fourteen countries around the world.
 



  





 Vitamin Well continues to grow and is now looking for a
 **Project Lead Commercial Operations** 
 to help develop our operational processes - both strategically and hands-on - at an international level. This is a role for someone who wants to combine analytical ability with practical drive in a fast-growing company within functional foods and beverages.
 



  





**About The Role** 




 As Project Lead Commercial Operations, you will lead strategic and operational projects within logistics and operations - with a focus on cost efficiency, operational improvements and sustainability. You will work closely with both our team in Sweden and our international markets to improve ways of working, challenge existing processes, and identify new, smarter solutions.
 



 The role also includes finding ways to reduce climate impact - without compromising on quality or speed.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities Include** 



* Lead procurement processes within logistics and related areas - from requirements specification to contract and implementation - and build strong supplier relationships
* Lead and coordinate Operations projects that improve quality, efficiency, and sustainability - both in Sweden and across our international markets
* Identify and implement process improvements that strengthen our competitive edge
* Contribute to our sustainability work by driving initiatives related to climate goals and compliance with reporting requirements
* Ensure budget follow-up and drive cost-efficiency



  





**Who are you** 




 We are looking for someone with a university degree in business, engineering, or a related field. You combine strong analytical and action-oriented skills with a humble mindset, and have a proven ability to break down complex challenges into concrete solutions. You thrive in a dynamic environment and enjoy taking ownership from idea to execution.
 



  





**We Believe That You** 



* Have approximately 1–3 years of experience leading strategic and operational projects
* Possess strong analytical skills and see opportunities where others see obstacles
* Are proactive and solution-oriented – you identify areas for improvement and ensure they’re realized
* Enjoy taking responsibility and delivering results, even in a fast-paced setting
* Are highly proficient in Excel, and preferably have experience with Power BI
* Have experience creating decision-making materials and presenting to various stakeholders
* Are fluent in both spoken and written English



  





**Welcome with your application at the latest August 15th 2025.** 




*We will review applications on an ongoing basis and the position may be filled before the last application day. Please note that the process may take longer than usual due to the summer holiday period. We appreciate LinkedIn, but to get a full picture of your experience, we ask you to also include a CV.* 




  





**Life at Vitamin Well Group** 




 Our growing family is made up of over 600 employees, representing a variety of cultures, experiences and diverse backgrounds. This diversity is a great asset as we continue our expansion and evolve our portfolio. At the same time, Vitamin Well is still very much a Swedish company, promoting Swedish values when it comes to both business and people. We treat each other in a fair and equal way, and we respect one another based on our qualities. As we expand Vitamin Well Group’s business, we are also committed to minimizing our environmental impact and continuously strive to lower emissions from for example production, logistics, and packaging.
 



  





 Working at Vitamin Well, we provide a dynamic environment defined by ambition, dedication, and an entrepreneurial spirit. In our action-oriented culture, the ability to make swift decisions is paramount in bringing ideas to fruition. We are committed to fostering an atmosphere where every individual's unique strengths contribute to our collective success. As a health and exercise-oriented company, we inspire an active lifestyle by partnering with top-performing athletes, but we also promote and support exercise among our employees.
 



  





*As part of the recruitment process, we may ask you to conduct a personality test as well as a test that measures logical ability. The purpose of the tests is to evaluate candidates as objective as possible and identify the best possible match for the role. The tests are based on solid research and are taken through our partner Alva Labs.*

title: Sr. Delivery Consultant - Data Architect, ProServe SDT North
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Delivery Consultant to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS).
   

  

 In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Delivery Consultant you will be proficient in architecting complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS.
   

  

 As trusted advisor to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud.
   

  

 We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an experienced technology professional, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Designing and implementing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions tailored to customer needs
* Providing technical guidance and troubleshooting support throughout project delivery
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective migration strategies
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts


 A day in the life
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences:
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job below, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

**Inclusive Team Culture**
 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

**Mentorship & Career Growth**
 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 5+ years' experience architecting and implementing data platforms (Data Lake, Data Lakehouse, Data Mesh, Data Warehouse) at enterprise scale
* Experience building end-to-end data solutions, including data ingestion (batch/streaming), storage, orchestration, governance, security, analytics, and observability.
* Highly technical and analytical mindset with ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
* Extensive hands-on experience with data platform technologies, including at least three of: Spark, Hadoop ecosystem, orchestration frameworks, MPP databases, NoSQL, streaming technologies, data catalogs, BI and visualization tools
* Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Python, Java, Scala), infrastructure as code, cloud platforms, and SQL.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience in a lead Data Architect role or similar Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math.
* Hands on experience leading large-scale global data warehousing and analytics projects and ability to lead effectively across organizations.
* Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including MPP and NoSQL databases, Data Warehouse design, BI reporting and Dashboard development.
* Customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior leaders regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2920503

title: Ekonomi-och VD-assistent
description:
**Vill du ha en varierad och utvecklande roll i en kreativ miljö?** 




 Kontrast söker en strukturerad och initiativrik person som vill kombinera arbete med siffror, administration och nya utmaningar. Du blir en viktig del av vår verksamhet där du stöttar både VD och ekonomiavdelningen – mitt i hjärtat av ett innovativt arkitektkontor.
 



  





 Hos oss får du arbeta i en roll som spänner över flera områden och ger stor möjlighet till insyn, påverkan och personlig utveckling.
 



  





**Om rollen** 
                
 



 Du kommer att arbeta i nära samarbete med företagets VD och bidra till det dagliga arbetet med både administrativt stöd och ekonomihantering. Rollen är uppdelad i två huvudområden: VD-assistans och ekonomi.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




**Som VD-assistent kommer du att:** 




 ·      Assistera VD i administrativa uppgifter och pågående projekt
 



 ·      Sköta mötesbokningar och kalenderplanering
 



 ·      Stötta i framtagande av budgetunderlag
 



 ·      Bidra i sälj- och anbudsarbete
 



 ·      Koordinera kommunikation med PR-byrå och stödja marknadsföringsinsatser
 



  





**Som ekonomiassistent kommer du att:** 




 ·      Ansvara för löpande bokföring samt kund- och leverantörsreskontra
 



 ·      Hantera löner och fakturering
 



 ·      Granska tidrapporter och ta fram fakturaunderlag
 



 ·      Kontrollera och administrera inkommande fakturor
 



 ·      Hantera kvitton och avvikande fakturor
 



  





**Vi söker dig som:** 




 ·      Har tidigare erfarenhet av bokföring och ekonomiadministration
 



 ·      Har arbetat i Fortnox och har goda kunskaper i Excel
 



 ·      Är självgående, strukturerad och noggrann
 



 ·      Är nyfiken, ansvarstagande och trivs i en roll med många kontaktytor
 



 ·      Trivs i ett prestigelöst team där alla hjälps åt
 



 ·      Talar och skriver svenska obehindrat
 



  





**Meriterande men ej krav:** 




 ·      Erfarenhet av entreprenad- eller avtalsjuridik
 



 ·      Intresse för IT och digitala verktyg
 



 ·      Kunskaper inom sociala medier eller CRM-system
 



 ·      Erfarenhet av bolagsbyggande eller arbete i tillväxtbolag
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder dig:** 




 ·      Ett deltidsschema med viss flexibilitet
 



 ·      Ett kreativt och målinriktat team i en unik miljö
 



 ·      En bred roll med mycket ansvar och utvecklingsmöjligheter
 



 ·      Ett vackert kontor i Hammarby Sjöstad, nära vatten och kommunikationer
 



 ·      Möjligheten att vara med och utveckla en växande verksamhet

title: V.I.E. - Engineering & Technology Consultant
description:
**At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.**

**Job Description**
-------------------

**We are seeking highly motivated and skilled engineers to join our teams in Sweden. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative, high-quality solutions that meet industry standards and regulatory requirements.**

**These roles span across several engineering disciplines and offer opportunities to contribute to impactful projects in the automotive and industrial sectors.**

**Scope :**

* **Software Engineering**
* **Product & Systems Engineering**
* **Data & AI**
* **Mechanical Engineering & Design**
* **Supply Chain & Procurement**

**Key Responsibilities** **:**

* **Client Collaboration: Support technical discussions with clients and stakeholders. Ensure engineering deliverables align with client expectations and contribute to building trust through reliable execution.**
* **Project Contribution: Actively participate in project execution, ensuring tasks are completed on time and within scope. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to maintain smooth workflows and resolve technical challenges.**
* **Technical Input & Innovation: Contribute ideas to improve product performance, development processes, or tools. Help identify technical opportunities that add value to the project or client.**
* **Teamwork & Support: Work closely with fellow engineers and project leads. Share knowledge, assist teammates, and foster a collaborative and productive work environment.**
* **Reporting & Communication: Document progress, highlight risks or blockers, and communicate effectively with technical leads or project managers. Provide clear updates on assigned tasks and technical issues.**

**What you'll love** **:**

* **A** **V.I.E. contract** **for a period of 12 months (renewable up to 24 months in total)**
* **An international experience within a large group offering a multitude of opportunities**
* **An opportunity to join the Capgemini Group on a long-term basis at the end of the V.I.E. assignment**
**Your Profile**
----------------

* **Education : Bachelor’s or master’s degree in one of the relevant engineering disciplines listed below**
* **All relevant experience in the listed engineering domains will be valued and taken into consideration**
* **Language: Proficiency in English is required. Knowledge of Swedish is considered an asset**

**Key competencies** ***(based on your profile and the targeted role)*** **:**

**Software Engineering :**

* **Programming languages: Java, Python, C#, JavaScript, etc.**
* **Software architecture: microservices, cloud-native design**
* **DevOps & CI/CD: Git, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes**
* **Automated testing & software quality assurance**
* **Agile/Scrum methodologies**
* **Application security & secure coding practices**

**Product & Systems Engineering :**

* **Systems engineering: MBSE, SysML, UML**
* **Requirements management & traceability**
* **System integration & validation**
* **User-centered design & usability**
* **Configuration management**
* **Cross-functional collaboration**

**Data & AI :**

* **Data analysis: SQL, Python, R**

Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.**

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Swedium Global is looking for a senior DevOps Engineer for one of its customer

**About the Role**  
We are seeking a highly skilled DevOps Engineer to join our growing team, helping us scale, secure, and streamline our infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines across modern cloud-native platforms. You will work closely with developers, cloud architects, and QA teams to enable faster, safer, and more reliable software delivery.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD pipelines (GitLab CI, Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitHub Actions)
* Automate infrastructure using Terraform, Helm, Ansible, or similar tools
* Manage containerized workloads on Kubernetes / OpenShift / EKS / AKS
* Ensure monitoring, logging, and alerting are in place using Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, etc.
* Champion DevSecOps principles by integrating security into pipelines and cloud configurations
* Work with microservices architectures, service meshes, and container networking
* Participate in incident response and root cause analysis for infrastructure or deployment issues
* Collaborate on cloud platform engineering (AWS / Azure / GCP)

**Must-Have Skills**

* 6+ years of experience in a DevOps or Cloud Engineering role
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes, Docker, and modern orchestration tools
* Proficiency in Terraform, infrastructure-as-code, and cloud provisioning
* CI/CD experience with GitLab CI, Jenkins, or similar tools
* Comfortable in at least one scripting language (Python, Bash, or Go)
* Experience working in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
* Familiar with Linux system administration, networking, and security hardening

**Nice-to-Have / Bonus Skills**

* Experience with OpenShift or RedHat ecosystems
* Knowledge of Istio, Linkerd, or other service meshes
* Familiar with policy-as-code tools (OPA/Gatekeeper)
* Experience in Fintech, Telecom, or high-compliance environments (ISO27001, GDPR, PCI)
* Certifications: CKA, AWS DevOps Pro, Azure DevOps Expert, or equivalent

**Email Address: bhawna.gugnani@swediumglobal.com**

Job Type: Full-time

title: Data Platform Architect
description:
**About Us:**  

**The Capgemini Group is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their businesses. We do this through unleashing human energy, imagination and ingenuity by harnessing the power of technology. By doing so we aim to achieve an inclusive and sustainable future. We are a responsible and diverse organization of nearly 336,000+ people. We have a presence in over 50 countries. Our rich 57-year heritage and deep industry expertise means that our clients trust us to address the entire breadth of their business needs. We provide strategy, design, operations and more, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms.**  

  

  



**Group IT**  

**Group IT delivers a comprehensive portfolio of technology services to one client: the Capgemini Group. We look after close to 336,000+ Capgemini employees in over 50 countries around the world, 24/7. We work with a huge variety of business lines, each requiring specific IT solutions and support and with people from diverse cultures, all collaborating with a common set of goals.**  

**As a strategic partner, Group IT is committed to enabling business success, delivering innovative, human-centric solutions that inspire our people and their customers. With 4,000 employees, Group IT plays a major role in enabling all of the Capgemini Group’s employees, in 50+ countries around the world, to work productively, every day. Access to these diverse geographies, cultures and demands – serviced with innovative technologies – makes Group IT an exciting and rewarding place to work.**  

  



**In support of the Capgemini Group and Group IT’s related goals and ambitions, Group IT is currently engaged in several major transformation programs. These programs represent an exciting opportunity to be involved in positioning and preparing Group IT – and Capgemini itself – to take on the challenges of the immediate future and the years ahead.**  

  



**A career in Group IT is truly a unique opportunity: to make the most of your skills; learn and grow as part of a world-leading technology organization and collaborate with other talented colleagues to succeed in a constantly evolving environment. Those who join our transformation programs will contribute to the future of Group IT and of Capgemini in a very real sense.**

**Job Description**
-------------------

**The Data Platform Architect will be responsible for the end-to-end design, development, and management of scalable and secure data platforms. This role includes handling end-to-end platform solutions, from infrastructure design to data security and deployment.**

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* **End-to-End Platform Solutions:**
* **Design, implement, and manage the entire lifecycle of the data platform, from infrastructure setup to the deployment of data services.**
* **Ensure that the platform meets business requirements and is scalable, secure, and cost-effective, providing an end-to-end solution for enterprise-wide data management needs.**
* **Oversee platform integration with enterprise applications, tools, and services while ensuring a seamless user experience.**

  

* **Platform Strategy & Architecture:**
* **Architect a robust and scalable data platform that supports data lakes, data warehouses, and real-time analytics solutions.**
* **Leverage Terraform for Infrastructure as Code (IaC) to automate infrastructure deployment and management processes.**
* **Align platform architecture with the overall enterprise data strategy and ensure it supports current and future data needs.**

  

* **Security & Landing Zone Implementation:**
* **Lead the implementation of data security best practices, including data encryption, access control, and auditing across the platform.**
* **Design and deploy secure landing zones in cloud environments (GCP, Azure) to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and safeguard sensitive data.**
* **Implement security controls that monitor and protect data assets across both cloud and on-premise environments.**

  

* **Performance Optimization & Scalability:**
* **Monitor and enhance the performance and scalability of the data platform, ensuring minimal downtime and optimized resource utilization.**
* **Utilize Terraform scripting to automate infrastructure management and deployment, ensuring scalability and agility.**
* **Design and manage efficient data pipelines for large-scale datasets, focusing on batch and real-time data processing.**

  

* **Networking & Data Security:**
* **Use fundamental networking skills to ensure secure and reliable data communication across on-premise and cloud environments.**
* **Implement security mechanisms such as encryption, network isolation, and access controls to protect data throughout its lifecycle.**
* **Collaborate with security teams to ensure data platform complies with governance policies and industry regulations.**
**Qualifications**
------------------

* **8+ years of experience in data architecture, platform engineering, or related fields, with a strong focus on designing and managing end-to-end platform solutions.**
* **Proven expertise in Terraform scripting, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), and cloud-based platforms (GCP, Azure).**
* **Solid experience in DevOps fundamentals and CI/CD pipeline implementation.**
* **Strong understanding of fundamental networking concepts (e.g., TCP/IP, DNS, VPNs, firewalls) for secure data transmission.**

**Technical Skills**

* **Expertise in Terraform scripting for automating infrastructure management.**
* **Strong knowledge of cloud platforms and services (e.g., GCP, Azure) and data technologies like Snowflake, Databricks, and Hadoop.**
* **Proficiency in DevOps tools such as Jenkins, Kubernetes, Docker, and CI/CD frameworks.**
* **In-depth understanding of data security best practices, including encryption, access control, and regulatory compliance.**
* **Experience designing and implementing secure landing zones for cloud platforms.**
**What we believe you will enjoy about working here**  

  

* **A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training, a global network of experts and an innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success.**
* **Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations.**
* **A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldness.**
* **A strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person.**

  

**Application**  

**In this recruitment process, we review applications and hire on an ongoing basis. As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.**  

  

**About Capgemini**  

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries.**  

  

**With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.**  

  

**Get The Future You Want** **|** **www.capgemini.com**

title: Product Owner Digital People Experience Value Stream
description:
Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water and shipping.  

  

As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too
About the job
As a Product Owner, you will play a crucial role in scaling our Digital People Experience portfolio with a focus on creating a global Alfa Laval people journey. Your initial role will be as a Product Owner for the Digital Workplace team with the potential to grow in more areas. Joining a dynamic team, you'll focus on operational excellence while collaborating across the full value stream, ensuring one prioritized backlog for the teams.  

You will be responsible for bridging the gap between strategy and operations, managing stakeholders, and prioritizing in a fast-paced environment. Your work will focus on the operational stability and development of our smart office initiatives, including AI and smart IoT technologies. You will play a crucial role in managing the DevOps cycle and working with an agile team to drive innovation. We are looking for a leader who can quickly ingest and align existing strategies and begin implementing new solutions within the first year.  

This position is a full-time role, available in Stockholm, Lund or Krakow, with the hiring manager based in Stockholm.
Key tasks:* Collaborate closely with stakeholders, bridging the gap between business and technology.
* Work with the Product Managers and Solution Architects to ensure operations and scale of a growing solution portfolio.
* Manage and prioritize the team backlog, addressing priorities, dependencies, and resource challenges.
* Lead and support an Agile development team of experts.
* Support, communicate, maintain global guidelines.


We are looking to hire the right person, so we are keen on hiring for potential rather than just experience. We believe that a growth mindset and strong leadership skills are the most important assets for this position.
Who you are
You are an exceptional communicator, both verbally and visually, thriving in the intersection of business and IT with the ability to present complex information clearly and inspire others. You are a natural and proactive leader who can effectively manage stakeholders and your team in a maturing context. As a strategic thinker, you are adept at bridging strategy with day-to-day operations and prioritizing effectively in a rapidly changing environment. You are a collaborative team player with a hunger to learn and adapt, focused on your professional and personal development. We want someone who is ready to grow with us.
What you know
You have proven experience in a leadership role within an IT environment, with a solid understanding of the DevOps cycle and how software works. Experience working within an agile team is a must, as is leading change management. The ideal candidate will also possess proficiency in both technology and business, complemented by excellent communication and presentation skills. While a university bachelor's degree is a minimum requirement (a master's degree in computer science would be a plus), what truly sets you apart is your experience with digital office solutions and user personas. Familiarity with agile methodologies like Scrum or SAFe and prior project management experience is advantageous. You must be fluent in English. While not mandatory, experience in real estate, IoT, and facilities is highly valued.
What’s in it for you?  

If you’re looking for a company where you can grow and make an impact, this is the place for you. We offer a challenging position in an open, friendly and innovative environment where we help each other to develop and create value. You'll work alongside a talented team of professionals, collaborating to address complex challenges and drive innovation. Your work will have a true impact for a sustainable future and Alfa Laval’s future success.
For more information, please contact:  

Joy Fajardo, Manager Product Owner and Digital Workplace at joy.fajardo@alfalaval.com  

Manal Mohamed, Talent Acquisition Partner at manal.mohamed@alfalaval.com
For Unions information, please contact:
Monica Anderberg, Unionen, at Monica.Anderberg@alfalaval.com  

Johan Ranhög, Akademikerna at Johan.Ranhög@alfalaval.com  

Stefan Sandell, Ledarna at Stefan.Sandell@alfalaval.com
Please send your application and resume no later than 31st of August 2025. We are conducting a continuous review of the applications received. We do not accept applications via email, due to General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioural traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games. Playing the games is mandatory.  

  

As part of our commitment to maintaining a safe and secure workplace, we conduct background checks on final candidates for this role.
We look forward to hearing from you soon!
 #LI-MM1
company_description: Alfa Laval is a leading global supplier of products and solutions for heat transfer, separation and fluid handling through our key products – heat exchangers, separators, pumps and valves.

title: Founding Engineer
description:
Want to help us build the next generation of learning plattforms at
 
 Mappi
 
 ?
 




  






 We are expanding the team with two founding engineers in Stockholm. You will help us on our mission to change how students worldwide learn computational subjects and how it’s integrated into schools.
 




  






 AI is transforming every industry. We believe education will be one of the most radically impacted, and one of the most important.
 




  






 Why join us?
 





 🛠️Build something that matters
 





 Building EdTech products is among the hardest, why? Because learning is both highly individual and at the same time needs to stay true to intricate learning curriculums. You’ll work on systems that need to adapt in real-time to each student, and evolve across entire school systems.
 




  






 🌍 Real classrooms, real impact
 





 We’re not just building for hobby learners. We’re scaling across real schools, with direct and measurable impact on students’ learning outcomes.
 




  






 💨 High paced team
 





 You will be working in a high paced small team obsessed with shipping high value features and high iteration speed. Not perfecting a button animation for a whole day but building complete infrastructure and heavy applied LLM systems.
 




  






 🏗️ Ownership
 





 Expect ownership in both the company and the product you build.
 





 From architecture decisions to building the brain behind Mappi, your work will shape how students learn.
 




  






 The roles:
 





 AI Engineer - Help build the core intelligence behind Mappi: adaptive feedback engines and real-time evaluation tools. Previous experience with LLMs, ML or fine-tuning is expected and previous educational AI work is a great plus.
 




  






 Infrastructure Engineer - Help us scale a highly personalized platform that will support hunreds of thousands of students in real-time. Efficent caching, scalable pipelines, real-time data, and scalable backend systems.
 




  





 Stack:
 



 Backend: Python, Django, Docker
 



 Frontend: Typescript, React, Chakra UI
 



  






 If you’re a skilled dev looking for your next big AI endeavour, this is the perfect opportunity.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Our client is a growing tech company working in the energy space. They are on a mission to focus on making energy systems smarter, more efficient, and more secure using software and data.
 



  





 If you care about tackling real-world challenges like climate change and energy resilience and want to be part of a team that is practical, curious, and hands-on, this could be for you.
 



  





**The role** 



* We are looking for someone with a solid engineering background and a collaborative mindset.
* This role sits in a small but busy team responsible for building the tools and infrastructure that help us analyze energy systems and make better decisions. You will be working on everything from building out our platform to improving how we move and manage data across the company.
* It’s a mix of hands-on engineering, collaboration, and problem-solving.



  





**Here is some of what you will be doing** 



* Building and maintaining a data platform that scales with our needs
* Writing and managing pipelines to collect, clean, and organise data
* Helping to define and improve data quality standards
* Working closely with others (both technical and non-technical) to make sure our data and models are easy to access!
* Being part of technical discussions and decision-making in the team



  





 We are looking for someone with a solid engineering background and a collaborative mindset.
 



  





**You don’t need to tick every box, but if this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you:** 



* Comfortable writing Python and working with GCP (or similar)
* About 5 years of experience in software engineering
* Can work independently, but knows when to reach out and loop others in
* Curious and thoughtful to think about the bigger picture, not just the code
* Likes working in a small, flat team where everyone pitches in
* Open to feedback, open with feedback



  





**Why Join Us?** 



* Your work will get used and have an impact; this isn’t a big corporate machine
* You will be part of a respectful, friendly team where people help each other out
* There’s room to grow, learn, and shape how things are done here



  





 If this sounds like a place you would thrive and enjoy working, we would love to hear from you.
